result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus R Ladwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 148 days credit.
Concurrent with: Milwaukee County Case 14CF1436

superMiscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or a combination of schooling.

Not to use or possess of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by the Agent.
No contact with the victim in the criminal complaint or Country Springs Hotel.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

records.addlTxt:
Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jesus R Ladwig in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Mark A. Pecora.   
State has complied with victim notification.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 2:
Total Prison:  57 Months.
Initial Confinement:  27 Months.
Extended Supervision:  30 Months.
148 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Milwaukee County Case 14CF1436


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint or Country Springs Hotel in Pewaukee.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.



Defendant to be transferred to D.C.I. - FORTHWITH.
Sentencing hearing on December 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Packet of Certificates of Completion and an Affidavit from the Victim.
Cash bail revoked pending sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on November 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.
